chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Merry Christine Cooper was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

miscConds.notes: Due forthwith; 23 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of fine, consecutive to 13CT252, but concurrent with jail sentence in this case.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for RECAP only.  Must complete RECAP.  Upon successfully completing RECAP, may petition for full Huber.  Consecutive to 13CT252.

IT IS ORDERED that under the provisions of Chapter 973 of the Wisconsin Statutes, the following action is hereby taken: As a condition of probation, the defendant is to serve 60 days in the Rock County Jail without Huber privileges, said term to commence effective the date of this order.

Defendant Merry Christine Cooper in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recap complete. Court orders full huber.
Hearing at 12-04-2015 01:00 pm

CASE RENUMBERED FROM 14CT299.  Defendant Merry Christine Cooper in court with attorney Sean Drury.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Guilty plea to count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation, consecutive to 13CT252, with conditions:  any treatment deemed necessary; 6 months Rock Co Jail, consecutive to 13CT252; complete RECAP; may petition for regular Huber upon successfully completing RECAP; 36 month DL revocation and IID; AODA; 23 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of fine, consecutive to 13CT252 but concurrent with jail in this case; no sentence credit.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.
Certified driving record
